intro: Erigeron pinkavii, commonly known as the pinkstem fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its slender stems and small, pinkish to white flowers bloom in the summer months. Erigeron pinkavii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments with minimal water.
